column1: Mirroring without Overimitation: Learning Functionally Equivalent Manipulation Actions
This paper presents a mirroring approach
column2: inspired by the neuroscience discovery of the mirror neurons
column3: to transfer demonstrated manipulation actions to robots. Designed to address the different embodiments between a human (demonstrator) and a robot
column4: this approach extends the classic robot Learning from Demonstration (LfD) in the following aspects:
